website_summaries.verdict: The 24-inch Acer R240HY is an In-Plane Switching (IPS) monitor that delivers good all-around performance for under $150, but you don't get many extras.

customer_reviews.title: 27" poor value
customer_reviews.text: The speaker volume is too low and the headphone jack wasnt working so I sent it back and was so glad I did because for another £20 got a perfect Asus 27" with amazing speakers and divine picture quality and Asus Splendid picture technology. the picture on the Acer is poor. Big black lumps of stuff and crude colours, painful to watch and I couldnt hear anything!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeni45

customer_reviews.title: great picture, sound is awful but I use HDMI ...
customer_reviews.text: great picture, sound is awful but I use HDMI from my laptop and a DJ soundard to hook to my amp so no biggie, sound is always rubbish on almost all monitors and TV's no matter the cost, only flaw it has that I can see is the monitor is wonky, should have screws in the back of the stand to hold it in the exact level position, other than that I'm very happy now that I have put a 20p coin under one side to level it :o)
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Really bad overshooting and response time problems
customer_reviews.text: The big problem with this monitor is the response time/overshoot. Don't bother using overdrive at all, you will notice the overshoot on any game. For daily tasks it is a good and cheap monitor, but that's all. If you plan to get this to connect a console or PC gaming, don't do it. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel Cardoso

customer_reviews.title: Acer R271 27 inch monitor with 3 different inputs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace a previous monitor that failed. It gives a great picture and it has a DVI input which is what I wanted. It also has VGA and HDMI inputs. The resolution is 1920x1080. The sound is not very good as is usual with built in monitor speakers, but I use an external 3 speaker set anyway. This is a really good monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cawood

customer_reviews.title: A very nice monitor at a bargain price.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with a lenovo laptop (E560, i7) It is great. The onboard screen adjustment is fiddly and not so good, but the Intel graphics drve in Windows 10 takes care of everything. The screen is about as big as you would want on a desktop. The colours are clean and vibrant. I only use it for video and photo editing and for that it seems perfect.
customer_reviews.author: TAC45

customer_reviews.title: Very good display
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for what I wanted it for - looking at two documents side by side without straining my eyes. Two drawbacks - I had to Google for how to get the stand to connect to the screen - the trick is to lower the screen onto the stand. Second drawback is that the buttons for on/off and menu functions are hard to tell apart as they are under the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Listener

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget monitor

I found this 27in monitor at a fantastic price not expecting a lot. However I have been very impressed and have no issues at all with this monitor. It is still going strong and I would highly recommend to anyone wanting a large monitor without the price tag.
